job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Competitive pay, high acuity, friendly environment
cons: Parking, few bonuses, older infrastructure

pros: Fair wages, pto accumulation, and continuing education benefits.
cons: The hospital has various scheduling practices for each unit and what each manager allows. There is obvious favoritism in some units and labor contracts are obviously not being followed. A facility this large should really have a centralized staffing team to meet the staffing and vacation requests of all the nursing staff in the facility to be fair, firm, and consistent. As it stands granting night shift employees time off/vacation requests typically requires finding your own coverage.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great benefits, compensation, and retirement
cons: Poor senior leadership, short staffing

pros: Safety net hospital and Level 1 trauma center with excellent outcomes. Diversity is present among both patients and staff. Mostly good work environment and we generally have what we need to do our jobs. Active nurse union and pay seems adequate. Annual education fund for each nurse to be used for CEUs, conferences, reference materials. I have observed that overall our staff members are highly dedicated, competent, and care about their patients. I bring my own family and receive my healthcare here.
cons: Experiences with managers varies, some are far better than others. Few opportunities for advancement for RNs and few opportunities for continuing education provided by hospital--you have to find your own. On boarding to a unit is virtually all you get if you are experienced RN. Constant financial stress on the institution due to being safety net hospital and caring for so many uninsured and people in poverty. Can be discouraging that there are not enough resources to meet some of the patients' needs, especially when they are ready to discharge to a different level of care. Sometimes patients and family members can be hostile and not trusting that we are doing our best for them.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Good teamwork, fast-paced environment, lots of learning opportunities
cons: Short staffing, frequent changes (not necessarily bad, but could get exhausting)

pros: You’ll work with some of the best medics in the greater metro area and if you stay for at a minimum of 20 years, you get the PERA Police and Fire pension. I believe starting wage is 25.50ish.
cons: You will be worked to your core and there will be little to no breaks. You will likely get mandated hours if you are new and under 2 years. Do not expect to get off at your end time as you will likely get a late call with no relief. Upper Management cares very little about your well being. Days off are very very rare unless you do the vacation bid at the beginning of the year and even then if staffing is bad enough, they can remove vacation days from you and you’ll be forced to work extra hours on days you work. The schedule is horrible and is either 4/5 10s in a row but more often it’s 5 10s in a row and you will not get OT for that 5th day. There is 12/14 hour shifts but not many.

pros: Great teamwork with coworkers and supervisors

cons: Healthcare is challenging work, and the last few years have been a struggle with the constant work due to the pandemic, a shortage of co-workers, and the continual fight for benefits and small pay increases. I could be wrong, but this might just be a struggle in most healthcare settings right now.

pros: Some of the pros are team work, communication, and benefits.

- not technically an FTE position even though you work 40 hr/wk (ie no benefits, paid leave, PTO, medical leave) although you can apply for an FTE position (these are hard to come by)

review_title: Flexible and great benefits, super stressful at times.
pros: Awesome benefits package, great health insurance for individuals. Some amazing people work here and keep the place afloat. Cool location and mission, great medical library with tons of educational resources and super helpful staff.
cons:
Wretched management, high turnover, and random firings when departments are planning improvements, which significantly stalls upgrades and delays progress. 

Way too much favoritism, and ironically, the 'favorites' are the worst employees. The more trained and skilled you are, the more they work you to the max to cover the slack of the inept, chronic sick callers, & FMLA abusers (there's a lot). 

Possibly the worst human resources department I've ever had to deal with. I wouldn't even give them a job at McDonald's mopping floors if they volunteered. They frequently lose critical paper work, and viciously hunt out good employees for the most trivial issues, while ignoring the worst, do nothing employees.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: They are one of the few places left to have pension and Union benefit and cater to low income or homeless patients.
cons:
They are running like a business rather than true health care, only interested in numbers. They have spent the last fives years expanding to keep up with the competition. However the last year they have been Millions in the hole now causing the middle staff and now lower staff to be cut.
The union has less pull anymore, we are lucky to get a 1% raise each year.

pros: The doctors ability to review, refer to patients to HOTC and sign orders in a timely manner was better when HCMC included HOTC in the Epic software.
cons: When HCMC bought HOTC they assured everyone they would not loose their positions and if so they would have an opportunity to find a position within the organization. No true they took over and laid-off people with over 18 years experience working in Hospice because they couldn't work a full 40 hours a week during Cancer treatment.  If HCMC takes over your company don't believe that you will have a job.

review_title: I am a staff nurse mostly working nights.
pros: If possible, managers try to be flexible with work schedules to accomadate life schedule.  Good health benefits and scheduling preference at clinics for employees.  New leadership seems to be trying to change the culture.
cons: Lack of communication system wide. Improving culture but "it's not my job" is a frequent refrain.  Issues take so long to get resolved that it appears they do not get resolved.  Supervisors and managers that do not always understand the jobs they are managing.

review_title: Great staff and great work being done while in leadership transition
pros: We have really great, talented, and compassionate staff. I love that we are a teaching and learning hospital. There is really some great work being done here and, as we are transitioning leadership, we have a great opportunity to change how we are engaged within our community.
cons: Currently we are transitioning leadership with new management and new staff. Change can be scary, but I'm hoping for the best. A lot of older employees have been here a very long time and need to choose between retiring or continuing to work.

job_title: Systems Analyst III in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The organizations mission and the dedication of the staff to serve the local community. Great benefits and pay.
cons: Dis-functional departments and too many silos. Managers do not seem to understand what is going on within their department or outside their department. Lack of growth opportunities. If you are ambitious I will recommend to try to lean as much as you can about the department you are join to make sure it is a good fit.

review_title: Sad to say this may be industry standard for Inpatient Psych Care but....
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Having some exceptional individuals 
Convenience of health insurance being through HHC
Diversity of staff
Cheap all use bus pass though work
Pro and Con- all the hours you could want
cons:
Constantly dealing with staffing issues
Poorly performing staff
Under qualified staff
Communication to all shifts not consistent
So much work that keeps you from direct care
Ugly/and highly non-therapeutic institutional like setting 
A good amount of staff struggle with English comprehension and speaking

review_title: DO NOT work in IT at Hennepin Healthcare
pros: Some of the staff is friendly and caring, but if you consider your personal health and well being important, don't work in IT. Cafeteria is decent.
cons: Toxic culture of bullyism ignored by senior leadership and HR.  No work-life balance while working for a healthcare organization! Non-IT people leading IT organization, so void of true thought leadership from IT perspective.  Micro-management of daily work. Example: Daily team huddles, Daily Tier 1 meetings, Daily Tier 2 meetings, each and every day of the year AND.  Multi weekly one on ones. Cuts daily productivity down big time. No 401k match for non-management staff. 5 years to vest in PERA. (State pension system). Assigned tons of non-position related work. Pay is below industry average. Rude, terse senior management.

review_title: Absolute lack of training in the Cancer Center
pros: The CEO and the board are fantastic. They eat in the cafeteria with everyone else, and came to the new employee orientation to meet everyone. Upper management is very approachable.
cons: I was hired and given absolutely no training in my position. I was told that I was a "nuisance" and that I was "wasting their time" because I had no idea how to do my job. I was terminated because I "wasn't comprehending the position". I have spoken with an unemployment attorney and we are putting together a case.

review_title: Good place to work, less than great patients
pros: Staff, pay is reasonable, equipment is good. It is a teaching hospital and a well known one at that, the residents come from all across the country to learn here and we have an amazing staff.
cons: The clientele is the uninsured, head cases and people who really cant handle life and they take it out on you and everyone else. This is not a gripe or a joke, this is a county hospital for the poor, uninsured or people who have been coming here for years and don't know any better.

review_title: Wonderful people horrible management, except upper management was awesome
job_title: Office Support Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Benefits, hours, co-workers, buildings are beautiful, customers are great. Strong beliefs that are in place of only they were followed.
cons: Management, office politics, people will belittle you due to their inability to do their own job. Be sure that your job descriptions are more accurate

review_title: HCMC--still a first-class hospital, but in crisis
pros:
Still has good benefit package.
Can feel you are doing Important work in community.
Nationally recognized hospital, can be proud of workplace.
cons:
Extreme budget shortfall--constant reductions of staff and increase of work pressure and responsibilities for remaining staff.
Unstable management--frequent changes of management people and of goal focus as hospital separates from County management.
Poor moral in almost all departments.

pros: A lot of areas where you can learn a lot. Despite someone else's comments that they racially discriminate against staff, that has not my experience.  I work I a very multicultural and multiracial environment and feel like most of my coworker's are happy in that regard.  Patient population is even more diverse, given its a safety net hospital.
cons: Management doesn't always make decisions in a practical manner or in a logical order of progression (top dogs).  Each unit has its own culture and some are more insular than others -- some in a good teamwork way and some in a "we are better and more important than other units" way.  CaRe has had issues with unfair expectations (wanting HCAs to be responsible for more than one one-to-one patient at a time even when rooms not adjacent) and with not responding when you need help because you are having to choose between patient and personal safety.

review_title: I worked in the Emergency Department. I loved my job, my coworkers, and the mission we stood for!
pros: I think The emergency department can be a wonderful place to work depending on your supervisor and the management. I believe in the mission statement! The doctors and residents are knowledgeable, compassionate, and always striving for the best for the patient. Never have I seen care compromise at all on the basis of an economic level or insurance or lack of insurance! Most of the staff takes pride in their work. They work diligently and hard in the care on behalf of the patient!
cons:
Huge issues with management. Constant turnover in management positions in the last 5 years. Management is huge on micromanaging. My manager wanted me to dummy down, do less work, and not to excel any further in my job.
Management needs to talk to the employees more often about their jobs and what the job expectations are especially when your new or don't know!
Huge turnover in employees. Over half to three quarters of the long-term employees have left the building, and management Allowed their knowledge and experience to walk out the door!
Most of the nursing staff is young and inexperienced. There is a constant turnover with nurses and healthcare assistance. Consistency is lacking, knowledge and experience is limited which is completely unfortunate!

job_title: Laboratory Team Lead in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Your work here makes a difference. Pay is competitive with the region. Good job security.s
cons: Raises are very low. Must work a minimum of 5 years to be vested at all in pension plan. Short staffing. Backfilling vacated positions takes MONTHS to get approved. Supply chain is a complete shitshow: nearly zero communication when supplies are back ordered; they often fail to submit orders to vendors; offer no explanation when things are missed. Overall, very little accountability when things go wrong.

pros: I have worked for HCMC for 16 years and overall enjoy my work there.  Staff are fun to work with and I enjoy the patient population they serve.  I also like the fact that it is a large teaching facility and enjoy working with the residents.  I feel for the most part the nurses are valued at the company.
cons: It is a large organization and communication is an issue sometimes.  As with most health care facilities balancing financial constraints with desirable staffing levels can be difficult.

review_title: Extensive advanced skills in all trauma and advanced life support procedures.
pros: Experience that excels all situations from birth until death. Research that is cutting edge relevant. A leader in Emergency Medicine. Support for the entire world of medicine. As easily accessed as You Tube!
cons: This fast paced department is for the brand new through peak performance. Time to hand off my knowledge and skills to those who follow. Best to move on at my prime.

pros: My co workers and patients that actually care is what kept me there for 5+ years.  Benefits are good but not worth the stressful environment.
cons: Total disconnect from management and HCA’s. No support and staffing was wacky... patient load was heavy with spotty teamwork. Hardly any recognition besides if something wasn’t done “right” and co workers would complain behind your back constantly.   Constant revolving door with patients and staff. Not worth benefits or pay to have a stressful life because of work.

review_title: Top heavy in directors and lack of managers causes confusion amoung workers
pros: Improvements do occur when senior management is aware of benefits. Company has long history will be around in 100 years.
cons: Not enough recognition, pay increases, training or upward mobility.

review_title: Lack of good caring managers only worried about what they can do that makes them look good.
pros: I get paid on time and have decent benefits.
cons: Time off is impossible. Issues of daily workplace are not addressed in a timely manner. Too much politics, clicks and silo mentality amoung management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Apple Valley, MN
pros: Intentions are good and the place does the best it can. Care is good, but the place is a little rough around the edges and very confusing (unnecessarily) to navigate.
cons: HCMC's heart is in the right place, but a never-ending emphasis on costs and an ongoing residual "county" mentality results in a frustrating culture for people with career experience elsewhere in the real world.

pros: Great manager that fights for your needs, great team atmosphere. Becomes a working family.
cons: Upper level management only cares about their bottom line dollar. No real employee working with patients (the people that matter) is safe. Upper management doesn't relate to floor staff, cleaning dept, kitchen staff etc...

review_title: HCMC is one of the best hospital to work in the downtown minneapolis area in Minnesota.  The organization have a great work ethics and their care is centered around family. Working there is a privilege.
pros: They have a very great health benefits.  Motivating salary, and incentives for well job done.
cons: They organization should try to balance the patient to nurse ratio in terms of staffing.

review_title: Had to quit to get paid
pros: I had to quit this employment contract to get paid - my manager wouldn't respond to how I could put time into system so I could get paid -  ignored every call, email for weeks, until I left - Now giving harmful reference.  Mislead about job but would have been more forgiving if had been paid as expected.
cons: Disappointed in honesty and communications

review_title: This was a very rewarding education experience

review_title: Unethical behavior supported by management and staff
pros: The pension is a plus, but that's only if you're able to become vested. The educational opportunities available to employees were also a nice perk.
cons: 1.) Unethical behavior supported by management. 2.) Poor communication by lower-level management. 3.) Backstabbing and spreading rumors by co-workers.

job_title: Principal Office Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Best benefits of any job I've had, top pay, and great people!
cons: It's a hospital so lots of sick people so you must be good at keeping yourself well.

review_title: Staff paying the price for leadership mistakes

cons: Workloads are high, executive leadership seems to be clueless

pros: HCMC had a great culture of being patient-centered. Beyond that, I found the organization quite adept at trying new programs, initiatives and different ways of looking at things.
cons: There are some issues of accountability across the organization, but nothing different from anywhere else.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great benefits, great place to learn, diversity great.
cons: 3 Tier -management absent, lack of support.   Doesn't understand job roles. Doesn't follow own Values.   More focused on hear-say than factual.  Underhanded,  lack of ethical management.

review_title: Recognize your employees are important to your success.
pros: Excellent benefits. Close community. True to its mission of serving all people.
cons: No education reimbursement. Very difficult to get promoted because the organization is very flat. Lack of communication from senior leaders. low employee morale.
